page.title: 19Stevenage New Town continued
page.content: We have a local bus service called Superbuses. They run regularly and most go to the town centre. They are driver-operated buses with a flat fare. There is also a long-distance service. The old people in the town are looked after. Many live in sheltered housing and they all have free bus passes. Each neighbourhood has doctors' and dentists' surgeries. Near the golf course, which covers 15 acres, is a large garden centre. There is also a small area of water meadow in our area. It has a stream which floods badly in the winter and sometimes in the summer. This year the water became polluted and lots of tadpoles, fish and newts died. Between the houses and the farmland is a busy railway line to Kings Cross, London.
